              </table>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(1)</font> Includes a balance of $145.7
million associated with incremental repair and replacement costs from a weak
die/packaging material set.&#160;&#160;In July 2008, we recorded a $196.0
million charge against cost of revenue to cover anticipated customer warranty,
repair, return, replacement and other associated costs arising from a weak
die/packaging material set. This charge was subsequently offset by deductions of
$50.3 million in deductions towards warranty accrual associated with incremental
repair and replacement costs from a weak die/packaging material
set.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
(2)</font> Includes $31.2 million for the three months ended April 26, 2009 in
payments related to the warranty accrual associated with incremental repair and
replacement costs from a weak die/packaging material set.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
connection with certain agreements that we have executed in the past, we have at
times provided indemnities to cover the indemnified party for matters such as
tax, product and employee liabilities. We have also on occasion included
intellectual property indemnification provisions in our technology related
agreements with third parties. Maximum potential future payments cannot be
estimated because many of these agreements do not have a maximum stated
liability. As such, we have not recorded any liability in our Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements for such indemnifications.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Note
12 - Commitments and Contingencies</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;3dfx</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 15, 2000, NVIDIA and one of our indirect subsidiaries entered into an
Asset Purchase Agreement, or APA, to purchase certain graphics chip assets from
3dfx.&#160;&#160;The transaction closed on April 18, 2001.&#160;&#160;That
acquisition, and 3dfx&#8217;s October 2002 bankruptcy filing, led to four lawsuits
against NVIDIA: two brought by 3dfx&#8217;s former landlords, one by 3dfx&#8217;s bankruptcy
trustee and the fourth by a committee of 3dfx&#8217;s equity security holders in the
bankruptcy estate.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Landlord
Lawsuits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In May
2002, we were served with a California state court complaint filed by the
landlord of 3dfx&#8217;s San Jose, California commercial real estate lease, Carlyle
Fortran Trust, or Carlyle. In December 2002, we were served with a California
state court complaint filed by the landlord of 3dfx&#8217;s Austin, Texas commercial
real estate lease, CarrAmerica Realty Corporation, or CarrAmerica. The landlords
both asserted claims for, among other things, interference with contract,
successor liability and fraudulent transfer. The landlords sought to recover
damages in the aggregate amount of approximately $15 million, representing
amounts then owed on the 3dfx leases.&#160;&#160;The cases were later removed to
the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Northern District of California when
3dfx filed its bankruptcy petition and consolidated for pretrial purposes with
an action brought by the bankruptcy trustee.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2005,
the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California withdrew the
reference to the Bankruptcy Court for the landlords&#8217; actions, and on November
10, 2005, granted our motion to dismiss both landlords&#8217;
complaints.&#160;&#160;The landlords filed amended complaints in early February
2006, and NVIDIA again filed motions to dismiss those claims. On September 29,
2006, the District Court dismissed the CarrAmerica action in its entirety and
without leave to amend.&#160;&#160;On December 15, 2006, the District Court also
dismissed the Carlyle action in its entirety.&#160;&#160;Both landlords filed
timely notices of appeal from those orders.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">18</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On July
17, 2008, the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit held oral
argument on the landlords&#8217; appeals.&#160; On November 25, 2008, the Court of
Appeals issued its opinion affirming the dismissal of Carlyle&#8217;s complaint in its
entirety.&#160;&#160;The Court of Appeals also affirmed the dismissal of most of
CarrAmerica&#8217;s complaint, but reversed the District Court&#8217;s dismissal of
CarrAmerica&#8217;s claims for interference with contractual relations and
fraud.&#160;&#160;On December 8, 2008, Carlyle filed a Request for Rehearing
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">En Banc</font>, which
CarrAmerica joined. That same day, Carlyle also filed a Motion for Clarification
of the Court&#8217;s Opinion.&#160;&#160;On January 22, 2009, the Court of Appeals
denied the Request for Rehearing <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">En Banc</font>, but clarified its
opinion affirming dismissal of the claims by stating that CarrAmerica had
standing to pursue claims for interference with contractual relations, fraud,
conspiracy and tort of another, and remanding Carlyle&#8217;s case with instructions
that the District Court evaluate whether the Trustee had abandoned any claims,
which Carlyle might have standing to pursue.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
District Court held a status conference in the CarrAmerica and Carlyle cases on
March 9, 2009.&#160;&#160;That same day, 3dfx&#8217;s bankruptcy Trustee filed in the
bankruptcy court a Notice of Trustee&#8217;s Intention to Compromise Controversy with
Carlyle Fortran Trust.&#160;&#160;According to that Notice, the Trustee would
abandon any claims it has against us for intentional interference with contract,
negligent interference with prospective economic advantage, aiding and abetting
breach of fiduciary duty, declaratory relief, unfair business practices and tort
of another, in exchange for which Carlyle will withdraw irrevocably its Proof of
Claim against the 3dfx bankruptcy estate and waive any further right of
distribution from the estate.&#160;&#160;In light of the Trustee&#8217;s notice, the
District Court ordered the parties to seek a hearing on the Notice on or before
April 24, 2009, ordered Carlyle and CarrAmerica to file amended complaints by
May 10, 2009, and set a further Case Management Conference for May 18,
2009.&#160;&#160;The parties have filed a stipulation requesting that the
District Court vacate the May 18, 2009 Case Management Conference date until
after Bankruptcy Court renders its decision.&#160;&#160;At a hearing on May 13,
2009, the Bankruptcy Court ruled that the Trustee had not abandoned any claims
against us, and denied the Trustee's Notice of Intention to Compromise
Controversy with Carlyle Fortran Trust without prejudice.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On April
2, 2009, Carlyle filed a petition&#160;for a writ of certiorari&#160;in the
United States Supreme Court, seeking review of the&#160;Court of Appeals
decision. &#160;We continue to believe that there is no merit to Carlyle or
CarrAmerica&#8217;s remaining claims.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Trustee
Lawsuit.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In March
2003, the Trustee appointed by the Bankruptcy Court to represent 3dfx&#8217;s
bankruptcy estate served his complaint on NVIDIA.&#160;&#160;The Trustee&#8217;s
complaint asserts claims for, among other things, successor liability and
fraudulent transfer and seeks additional payments from us.&#160;&#160;The
Trustee&#8217;s fraudulent transfer theory alleged that NVIDIA had failed to pay
reasonably equivalent value for 3dfx&#8217;s assets, and sought recovery of the
difference between the $70 million paid and the alleged fair value, which the
Trustee estimated to exceed $50 million.&#160;&#160;The Trustee&#8217;s successor
liability theory alleged NVIDIA was effectively 3dfx&#8217;s legal successor and was
therefore responsible for all of 3dfx&#8217;s unpaid liabilities.&#160;&#160;This
action was consolidated for pretrial purposes with the landlord cases, as noted
above.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
October 13, 2005, the Bankruptcy Court heard the Trustee&#8217;s motion for summary
adjudication, and on December 23, 2005, denied that motion in all material
respects and held that NVIDIA may not dispute that the value of the 3dfx
transaction was less than $108 million. The Bankruptcy Court denied the
Trustee&#8217;s request to find that the value of the 3dfx assets conveyed to NVIDIA
was at least $108 million.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In early
November 2005, after several months of mediation, NVIDIA and the Official
Committee of Unsecured Creditors, or the Creditors&#8217; Committee, agreed to a Plan
of Liquidation of 3dfx, which included a conditional settlement of the Trustee&#8217;s
claims against us. This conditional settlement was subject to a confirmation
process through a vote of creditors and the review and approval of the
Bankruptcy Court. The conditional settlement called for a payment by NVIDIA of
approximately $30.6 million to the 3dfx estate. Under the settlement, $5.6
million related to various administrative expenses and Trustee fees, and $25.0
million related to the satisfaction of debts and liabilities owed to the general
unsecured creditors of 3dfx. Accordingly, during the three month period ended
October 30, 2005, we recorded $5.6 million as a charge to settlement costs and
$25.0 million as additional purchase price for 3dfx.&#160;&#160;The Trustee
advised that he intended to object to the settlement. The conditional settlement
never progressed substantially through the confirmation process.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 21, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court scheduled a trial for one portion of the
Trustee&#8217;s case against NVIDIA. On January 2, 2007, NVIDIA terminated the
settlement agreement on grounds that the Bankruptcy Court had failed to proceed
toward confirmation of the Creditors&#8217; Committee&#8217;s plan. A non-jury trial began
on March 21, 2007 on valuation issues in the Trustee&#8217;s constructive fraudulent
transfer claims against NVIDIA. Specifically, the Bankruptcy Court tried four
questions: (1) what did 3dfx transfer to NVIDIA in the APA?; (2) of what was
transferred, what qualifies as &#8220;property&#8221; subject to the Bankruptcy Court&#8217;s
avoidance powers under the Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act and relevant
bankruptcy code provisions?; (3) what is the fair market value of the &#8220;property&#8221;
identified in answer to question (2)?; and (4) was the $70 million that NVIDIA
paid &#8220;reasonably equivalent&#8221; to the fair market value of that property? The
parties completed post-trial briefing on May 25, 2007.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">19</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On April
30, 2008, the Bankruptcy Court issued its Memorandum Decision After Trial, in
which it provided a detailed summary of the trial proceedings and the parties&#8217;
contentions and evidence and concluded that &#8220;the creditors of 3dfx were not
injured by the Transaction.&#8221;&#160;&#160;This decision did not entirely dispose
of the Trustee&#8217;s action, however, as the Trustee&#8217;s claims for successor
liability and intentional fraudulent conveyance were still
pending.&#160;&#160;On June 19, 2008, NVIDIA filed a motion for summary judgment
to convert the Memorandum Decision After Trial to a final
judgment.&#160;&#160;That motion was granted in its entirety and judgment was
entered in NVIDIA&#8217;s favor on September 11, 2008. The Trustee filed a Notice of
Appeal from that judgment on September 22, 2008, and on September 25, 2008,
NVIDIA exercised its election to have the appeal heard by the United States
District Court, where the appeal is pending.&#160;&#160;&#160;The District Court
has set the Trustee&#8217;s appeal for hearing on June 10, 2009.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While the
conditional settlement reached in November 2005 never progressed through the
confirmation process, the Trustee&#8217;s case still remains pending
appeal.&#160;&#160;As such, we have not reversed the accrual of $30.6 million -
$5.6 million as a charge to settlement costs and $25.0 million as additional
purchase price for 3dfx &#8211; that we recorded during the three months ended October
30, 2005, pending resolution of the appeal of the Trustee&#8217;s case. We do not
believe the resolution of this matter will have a material impact on our results
of operations or financial position.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Equity Committee Lawsuit.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 8, 2005, the Trustee filed a Form 8-K on behalf of 3dfx, disclosing the
terms of the conditional settlement agreement between NVIDIA and the Creditor&#8217;s
Committee. Thereafter, certain 3dfx shareholders filed a petition with the
Bankruptcy Court to appoint an official committee to represent the claimed
interests of 3dfx shareholders. The court granted that petition and appointed an
Equity Securities Holders&#8217; Committee, or the Equity Committee. The Equity
Committee thereafter sought and obtained an order granting it standing to bring
suit against NVIDIA, for the benefit of the bankruptcy estate, to compel NVIDIA
to pay the stock consideration then unpaid from the APA, and filed its own
competing plan of reorganization/liquidation. The Equity Committee&#8217;s plan
assumes that 3dfx can raise additional equity capital that would be used to
retire all of 3dfx&#8217;s debts, and thus to trigger NVIDIA&#8217;s obligation to pay six
million shares of stock consideration specified in the APA. NVIDIA contends,
among other things, that such a commitment is not sufficient and that its
obligation to pay the stock consideration had long before been extinguished. On
May 1, 2006, the Equity Committee filed its lawsuit for declaratory relief to
compel NVIDIA to pay the stock consideration. In addition, the Equity Committee
filed a motion seeking Bankruptcy Court approval of investor protections for
Harbinger Capital Partners Master Fund I, Ltd., an equity investment fund that
conditionally agreed to pay no more than $51.5 million for preferred stock in
3dfx. The hearing on that motion was held on January 18, 2007, and the
Bankruptcy Court approved the proposed protections.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">After the
Bankruptcy Court denied our motion to dismiss on September 6, 2006, the Equity
Committee again amended its complaint, and NVIDIA moved to dismiss that amended
complaint as well. On December 21, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court granted the motion
as to one of the Equity Committee&#8217;s claims, and denied it as to the others.
However, the Bankruptcy Court also ruled that NVIDIA would only be required to
answer the first three causes of action by which the Equity Committee seeks
determinations that (1) the APA was not terminated before 3dfx filed for
bankruptcy protection, (2) the 3dfx bankruptcy estate still holds some rights in
the APA, and (3) the APA is capable of being assumed by the bankruptcy
estate.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Because
of the trial of the Trustee&#8217;s fraudulent transfer claims against NVIDIA, the
Equity Committee&#8217;s lawsuit did not progress substantially in 2007.&#160;&#160;On
July 31, 2008, the Equity Committee filed a motion for summary judgment on its
first three causes of action.&#160;&#160;On September 15, 2008, NVIDIA filed a
cross-motion for summary judgment.&#160;&#160;On October 24, 2008, the Court
held a hearing on the parties&#8217; cross-motions for summary judgment.&#160;&#160;On
January 6, 2009, the Bankruptcy Court issued a Memorandum Decision granting
NVIDIA&#8217;s motion and denying the Equity Committee&#8217;s motion, and entered an Order
to that effect on January 30, 2009. On February 27, 2009, the Bankruptcy Court
entered judgment in favor of NVIDIA. The Equity Committee has waived its right
to appeal by stipulation entered on February 18, 2009, and the judgment is now
final.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Proceedings,
SEC inquiry and lawsuits related to our historical stock option granting
practices</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In June
2006, the Audit Committee of the Board of NVIDIA, or Audit Committee, began a
review of our stock option practices based on the results of an internal review
voluntarily undertaken by management. The Audit Committee, with the assistance
of outside legal counsel, completed its review on November 13, 2006 when the
Audit Committee reported its findings to our full Board. The review covered
option grants to all employees, directors and consultants for all grant dates
during the period from our initial public offering in January 1999 through June
2006. Based on the findings of the Audit Committee and our internal review, we
identified a number of occasions on which we used an incorrect measurement date
for financial accounting and reporting purposes.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">20</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
voluntarily contacted the SEC regarding the Audit Committee&#8217;s
review.&#160;&#160;In late August 2006, the SEC initiated an inquiry related to
our historical stock option grant practices. In October 2006, we met with the
SEC and provided it with a review of the status of the Audit Committee&#8217;s review.
In November 2006, we voluntarily provided the SEC with additional documents. We
continued to cooperate with the SEC throughout its inquiry.&#160;&#160;On
October 26, 2007, the SEC formally notified us that the SEC&#8217;s investigation
concerning our historical stock option granting practices had been terminated
and that no enforcement action was recommended.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Concurrently
with our internal review and the SEC&#8217;s inquiry, since September 29, 2006, ten
derivative cases were filed in state and federal courts asserting claims
concerning errors related to our historical stock option granting practices and
associated accounting for stock-based compensation expense. These complaints
were filed in various courts, including the California Superior Court, Santa
Clara&#160;County, the United States District Court for the Northern District of
California, and the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware in and for New
Castle&#160;County. The California Superior Court cases were subsequently
consolidated as were the cases pending in the Northern District of California.
All of the cases purported to be brought derivatively on behalf of NVIDIA
against members of our Board and several of our current and former officers and
directors. Plaintiffs in these actions alleged claims for, among other things,
breach of fiduciary duty, unjust enrichment, insider selling, abuse of control,
gross mismanagement, waste, and constructive fraud. The Northern District of
California action also alleged violations of federal provisions, including
Sections 10(b) and 14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The plaintiffs
sought to recover for NVIDIA, among other things, damages in an unspecified
amount, rescission, punitive damages, treble damages for insider selling, and
fees and costs. Plaintiffs also sought an accounting, a constructive trust and
other equitable relief.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On August
5, 2007, our Board authorized the formation of a Special Litigation Committee to
investigate, evaluate, and make a determination as to how NVIDIA should proceed
with respect to the claims and allegations asserted in the underlying derivative
cases brought on behalf of NVIDIA.&#160;&#160;Between June 2007 and September
2008 the parties to the actions and the Special Litigation Committee engaged in
settlement discussions, including four mediation sessions before the Honorable
Edward Infante (Ret.).&#160;&#160;On September 22, 2008, we disclosed that we
had entered into Memoranda of Understanding regarding the settlement of all
derivative actions concerning our historical stock option granting
practices.&#160;&#160;On November 10, 2008, the definitive settlement agreements
were concurrently filed in the Chancery Court of Delaware and the United States
District Court for the Northern District of California.&#160;&#160;The
settlement agreements do not contain any admission of wrongdoing or fault on the
part of NVIDIA, our board of directors or executive officers.&#160;&#160;The
terms of the settlement agreements include, among other things, the agreement by
the board of directors to continue and to implement certain corporate governance
changes; acknowledgement of the prior amendment of certain options through
re-pricings and limitations of the relevant exercise periods; an agreement by
Jen-Hsun Huang, our president and chief executive officer, to amend additional
options to increase the aggregate exercise price of such options by $3.5 million
or to cancel options with an intrinsic value of $3.5 million; an $8.0 million
cash payment by our insurance carrier to NVIDIA; and an agreement to not object
to attorneys&#8217; fees to be paid by NVIDIA to plaintiffs&#8217; counsel of no more than
$7.25 million, if approved by the courts.&#160;&#160;On January 24, 2009, a
Notice of Pendency and Settlement of Shareholder Derivative Actions was mailed
to shareholders of record and posted on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">www.nvidia.com</font>.&#160;&#160;On
March 11, 2009, a final settlement hearing was held in the Delaware Chancery
Court&#160;and, on the same date, the Court entered&#160;a Final Order and
Judgment, which approved the settlement and requested attorneys&#8217; fees, and
dismissed the Delaware action with prejudice.&#160; On March 17, 2009, a final
settlement hearing was held in the District Court for the Northern District of
California.&#160;&#160;The following day, the District Court entered an Order
and Final Judgment approving the settlement and requested attorneys&#8217; fees, and
dismissing the action with prejudice.&#160;&#160;On April 2, 2009, pursuant to
the settlement approved by the District Court, the parties to the action pending
in the California Superior Court, Santa Clara&#160;County filed a stipulation to
have the Santa Clara action dismissed.&#160;&#160;On April 6, 2009, the Santa
Clara Superior Court granted the stipulation and dismissed the action&#160;with
prejudice.&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;Department
of Justice Subpoena and Investigation, and Civil Cases</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
November 29, 2006, we received a subpoena from the San Francisco Office of the
Antitrust Division of the United States Department of Justice, or DOJ, in
connection with the DOJ&#8217;s investigation into potential antitrust violations
related to GPUs and cards.&#160;&#160;&#160;On October 10, 2008, the DOJ
formally notified us that the DOJ investigation has been closed. No specific
allegations were made against NVIDIA during the investigation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
January 25, 2009, over 50 civil complaints have been filed against us. The
majority of the complaints were filed in the Northern District of California,
several were filed in the Central District of California, and other cases were
filed in several other Federal district courts.&#160;&#160;On April 18, 2007,
the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation transferred the actions currently
pending outside of the Northern District of California to the Northern District
of California for coordination of pretrial proceedings before the Honorable
William H. Alsup.&#160;&#160;By agreement of the parties, Judge Alsup will
retain jurisdiction over the consolidated cases through trial or other
resolution.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">21</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
In the consolidated proceedings, two groups of plaintiffs (one putatively
representing all direct purchasers of GPUs and the other putatively representing
all indirect purchasers) filed consolidated, amended class-action complaints.
These complaints purport to assert federal antitrust claims based on alleged
price fixing, market allocation, and other alleged anti-competitive agreements
between us and ATI Technologies, ULC., or ATI, and Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.,
or AMD, as a result of its acquisition of ATI.&#160;&#160;The indirect
purchasers&#8217; consolidated amended complaint also asserts a variety of state law
antitrust, unfair competition and consumer protection claims on the same
allegations, as well as a common law claim for unjust enrichment.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Plaintiffs
filed their first consolidated complaints on June 14, 2007.&#160;&#160;On July
16, 2007, we moved to dismiss those complaints.&#160;&#160;The motions to
dismiss were heard by Judge Alsup on September 20, 2007.&#160;&#160;The court
subsequently granted and denied the motions in part, and gave the plaintiffs
leave to move to amend the complaints.&#160;&#160;On November 7, 2007, the court
granted plaintiffs&#8217; motion to file amended complaints, ordered defendants to
answer the complaints, lifted a previously entered stay on discovery, and set a
trial date for January 12, 2009.&#160;&#160;Plaintiffs filed motions for class
certification on April 24, 2008.&#160;&#160;We filed oppositions to the motions
on May 20, 2008.&#160;&#160;On July 18, 2008, the court ruled on Plaintiffs&#8217;
class certification motions.&#160;&#160;The court denied class certification for
the proposed class of indirect purchasers.&#160;&#160;The court granted in part
class certification for the direct purchasers but limited the direct purchaser
class to individual purchasers that acquired graphics processing cards products
directly from NVIDIA or ATI from their websites between December 4, 2002 and
November 7, 2007.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
September&#160;16, 2008, we executed a settlement agreement, or the Agreement,
in connection with the claims of the certified class of direct purchaser
plaintiffs approved by the court.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the Agreement, NVIDIA
has paid $850,000 into a $1.7 million fund to be made available for payments to
the certified class. We are not obligated under the Agreement to pay plaintiffs&#8217;
attorneys&#8217; fees, costs, or make any other payments in connection with the
settlement other than the payment of $850,000. The Agreement has received final
approval from the court and disposes of all claims and appeals raised by the
certified class in the complaints against NVIDIA. Because the Court certified a
class consisting only of a narrow group of direct purchasers, the Agreement does
not resolve any claims that other direct purchasers may assert.&#160; In
addition, on September&#160;9, 2008, we reached a settlement agreement with the
remaining individual indirect purchaser plaintiffs pursuant to which NVIDIA paid
$112,500 in exchange for a dismissal of all claims and appeals related to the
complaints raised by the individual indirect purchaser plaintiffs. This
settlement is not subject to the approval of the court. Pursuant to the
settlement, the individual indirect purchaser plaintiffs in the complaints have
dismissed their claims and withdrawn their appeal of the class certification
ruling.&#160;&#160;Because the Court did not certify a class of indirect
purchasers, this settlement agreement resolves only the claims of those indirect
purchasers that were named in&#160;the various actions.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Rambus
Corporation</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On July
10, 2008, Rambus Corporation, or Rambus, filed suit against NVIDIA Corporation,
asserting patent infringement of 17 patents claimed to be owned by Rambus.&#160;
Rambus seeks damages, enhanced damages and injunctive relief.&#160;&#160;The
lawsuit was filed in the Northern District of California in San Jose,
California.&#160;&#160; On July 11, 2008, NVIDIA filed suit against Rambus in
the Middle District of North Carolina asserting numerous claims, including
antitrust and other claims.&#160;&#160; NVIDIA seeks damages, enhanced damages
and injunctive relief.&#160;&#160; Rambus has since dropped two patents from its
lawsuit in the Northern District of California.&#160;&#160;The two cases have
recently been consolidated into a single&#160;proceeding in the Northern
District of California.&#160; On&#160;April 13, 2009, the Court issued an order
staying motion practice and allowing only document discovery to proceed.&#160; A
case management conference is scheduled for August 21, 2009.&#160; On November
6, 2008, Rambus filed a complaint alleging a violation of 19 U.S.C. Section 1337
based on a claim of patent infringement against NVIDIA and 14 other respondents
with the U.S. International Trade Commission, or ITC.&#160;&#160;The complaint
seeks an exclusion order barring the importation of products that allegedly
infringe nine Rambus patents.&#160;&#160;The ITC has instituted the
investigation and a trial is currently scheduled to begin August 17, 2009.&#160;
NVIDIA intends to pursue its offensive and defensive cases vigorously in both
actions.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">22</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Product
Defect Litigation and Securities Cases</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
September,&#160;October and November&#160;2008, several putative consumer class
action lawsuits were filed against us, asserting various claims arising from a
weak die/packaging material set in certain versions of our previous generation
MCP and GPU products used in notebook systems.&#160;&#160;Most of the lawsuits
were filed in Federal Court in the Northern District of California, but three
were filed in state court in California, in Federal Court in New York, and in
Federal Court in Texas.&#160;&#160;Those three actions have since been removed
or transferred to the United States District Court for the Northern District of
California, San Jose Division, where all of the actions now are currently
pending.&#160;&#160;The various lawsuits are titled <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Nakash v. NVIDIA Corp.</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Feinstein v. NVIDIA Corp.</font>,
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Inicom Networks, Inc. v.
NVIDIA Corp. and Dell, Inc. and Hewlett Packard</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Olivos v. NVIDIA Corp.</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Dell, Inc. and Hewlett
Packard</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Sielicki v.
NVIDIA Corp. and Dell, Inc.</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Cormier v. NVIDIA Corp.</font>,
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">National Business Officers
Association, Inc. v. NVIDIA Corp.</font>, and <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">West v. NVIDIA
Corp</font>.&#160;&#160;The First Amended Complaint was filed on October 27,
2008, which no longer asserted claims against Dell, Inc.&#160;&#160;The various
complaints assert claims for, among other things, breach of warranty, violations
of the Consumer Legal Remedies Act, Business &amp; Professions Code sections
17200 and 17500 and other consumer protection statutes under the laws of various
jurisdictions, unjust enrichment, and strict liability.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
District Court has entered orders deeming all of the above cases<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: line-through">&#160;</font>related
under the relevant local rules.&#160;&#160;On December 11, 2008, NVIDIA filed a
motion to consolidate all of the aforementioned consumer class action
cases.&#160;&#160;On February 26, 2009, the District Court consolidated the
cases, as well as two other cases pending against Hewlett-Packard, under the
caption &#8220;The NVIDIA GPU Litigation&#8221; and ordered the plaintiffs to file lead
counsel motions by March 2, 2009.&#160;&#160;On March 2, 2009, several of the
parties filed motions for appointment of lead counsel and briefs addressing
certain related issues.&#160;&#160;&#160;On April 10, 2009, the District Court
appointed Milberg LLP lead counsel.&#160; On May 6, 2009, the plaintiffs filed
an Amended Consolidated Complaint, alleging claims for violations of California
Business and Professions Code Section 17200,&#160;Breach of Implied Warranty
under&#160;California Civil Code Section 1792, Breach of the&#160;Implied
Warranty of Merchantability under the laws of 27 other states, Breach of
Warranty under the Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act,&#160;Unjust Enrichment,
violations of the New Jersey Consumer Fraud&#160;Act, Strict Liability and
Negligence, and violation of California&#8217;s Consumer Legal Remedies Act.&#160; On
May 14, 2009, the District Court entered a case schedule order, which sets
a&#160;&#160;September 28, 2009 hearing date for an anticipated motion to
dismiss, a December 7, 2009 hearing date for anticipated class certification
motion, and a July 12, 2010 fact discovery deadline.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
September 2008, three putative securities class actions, or the Actions, were
filed in the United States District Court for the Northern District of
California arising out of our announcements on July 2, 2008, that we would take
a charge against cost of revenue to cover anticipated costs and expenses arising
from a weak die/packaging material set in certain versions of our previous
generation MCP and GPU products and that we were revising financial guidance for
our second quarter of fiscal year 2009. The Actions purport to be brought on
behalf of purchasers of NVIDIA stock and assert claims for violations of
Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. On
October 30, 2008, the Actions were consolidated under the caption <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">In re NVIDIA Corporation Securities
Litigation</font>, Civil Action No. 08-CV-04260-JW (HRL). Lead Plaintiffs and
Lead Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel were appointed on December 23, 2008. On February 6,
2009, co-Lead Plaintiff filed a Writ of Mandamus with the Ninth Circuit Court of
Appeals challenging the designation of co-Lead Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel. On February
19, 2009, co-Lead Plaintiff filed with the District Court, a motion to stay the
District Court proceedings pending resolution of the Writ of Mandamus by the
Ninth Circuit. On February 24, 2009, Judge Ware granted the stay. The Writ is
still pending in the Court of Appeals. We intend to take all appropriate action
with respect to the above cases.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Intel
Corporation</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
February 17, 2009, Intel Corporation filed suit against NVIDIA Corporation,
seeking declaratory and injunctive relief relating to a licensing agreement that
the parties signed in 2004.&#160;&#160;The lawsuit was filed in Delaware
Chancery Court.&#160;&#160;Intel seeks an order from the Court declaring that
the license does not extend to certain future NVIDIA chipset products, and
enjoining NVIDIA from stating that it has licensing rights for these products.
The lawsuit seeks no damages from NVIDIA.&#160;&#160;If Intel successfully
obtains such a court order, we could be unable to sell our MCP products for use
with certain Intel processors and our competitive position would be
harmed.&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On March
23, 2009, we filed our answer to Intel's complaint and also asserted
counterclaims for declaratory relief, injunctive relief, breach of contract, and
breach of the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.&#160;&#160;Our
counterclaims seek an order declaring that NVIDIA has the right to sell certain
chipset products with Intel's processors under the 2004 licensing agreement, and
enjoining Intel from interfering with NVIDIA's licensing rights.&#160;&#160;In
addition, the counterclaims seek a finding that Intel has materially breached
its obligations under the 2004 licensing agreement, and requests various
remedies for that breach, including termination of Intel's cross licensing
rights.&#160;&#160;On April 16, 2009, Intel filed its answer to our
counterclaims.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The case
is still in its preliminary stages and no trial date has been
set.&#160;&#160;NVIDIA disputes Intel&#8217;s claims and intends to vigorously defend
these claims, as well as pursue its counterclaims.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">23</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Note
13 - Stockholders&#8217; Equity</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stock
Repurchase Program</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
fiscal year 2005, we announced that our Board of Directors, or Board, had
authorized a stock repurchase program to repurchase shares of our common stock,
subject to certain specifications, up to an aggregate maximum amount of $300
million.&#160;&#160;During fiscal year 2007, the Board further approved an
increase of $400 million to the original stock repurchase program. In fiscal
year 2008, we announced a stock repurchase program&#160;under which we may
purchase up to an additional $1.0 billion of our common stock over a three year
period through May 2010. On August 12, 2008, we announced that our Board further
authorized an additional increase of $1.0 billion to the stock repurchase
program. As a result of these increases, we have an ongoing authorization from
the Board, subject to certain specifications, to repurchase shares of our common
stock up to an aggregate maximum amount of $2.7 billion through May
2010.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
repurchases will be made from time to time in the open market, in privately
negotiated transactions, or in structured stock repurchase programs, and may be
made in one or more larger repurchases, in compliance with the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 Rule 10b-18, subject to market conditions, applicable legal
requirements, and other factors. The program does not obligate NVIDIA to acquire
any particular amount of common stock and the program may be suspended at any
time at our discretion.&#160;As part of our share repurchase program, we have
entered into, and we may continue to enter into, structured share repurchase
transactions with financial institutions. These agreements generally require
that we make an up-front payment in exchange for the right to receive a fixed
number of shares of our common stock upon execution of the agreement, and a
potential incremental number of shares of our common stock, within a
pre-determined range, at the end of the term of the agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the three months ended April 26, 2009, we did not enter into any structured
share repurchase transactions or otherwise purchase any shares of our common
stock.&#160;Through April 26, 2009, we have repurchased an aggregate of 90.9
million shares under our stock repurchase program for a total cost of
$1.46&#160;billion.&#160;&#160;As of April 26, 2009, we are authorized, subject
to certain specifications, to repurchase shares of our common stock up to an
additional amount of $1.24 billion through May 2010.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;Please
refer to Note 3 and Note 4 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial
Statements for further information regarding stock-based compensation related to
our March 2009 stock option purchase and related to equity awards granted under
our equity incentive programs.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Convertible
Preferred Stock</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
April 26, 2009 and January 25, 2009, there were no shares of preferred stock
outstanding.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Note
14 - Comprehensive Income (Loss)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Comprehensive
income (loss) consists of net income (loss) and other comprehensive income
(loss). Other comprehensive income or loss components include unrealized gains
or losses on available-for-sale securities, net of tax. The components of
comprehensive income, net of tax, were as follows:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;

        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>

      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">24</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NVIDIA
CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES
TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)
</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Note
15 - Segment Information</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our Chief
Executive Officer, who is considered to be our chief operating decision maker,
or CODM, reviews financial information presented on an&#160;operating segment
basis for purposes of making operating decisions and assessing financial
performance.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We report
financial information for four operating segments to our CODM: the GPU business,
which is comprised primarily of our GeForce products that support desktop and
notebook personal computers, or PCs, plus memory products; the professional
solutions business, or PSB, which is comprised of our NVIDIA Quadro professional
workstation products and other professional graphics products, including our
NVIDIA Tesla&#160;high-performance computing products; the media and
communications processor, or MCP, business which is comprised of NVIDIA nForce
core logic and motherboard GPU products; and our consumer products business, or
CPB, which is comprised of our GoForce and APX mobile brands and products that
support handheld personal media players, or PMPs, personal digital assistants,
or PDAs, cellular phones and other handheld devices.&#160;&#160;CPB also
includes license, royalty, other revenue and associated costs related to video
game consoles and other digital consumer electronics devices.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to these operating segments, we have the &#8220;All Other&#8221; category that
includes human resources, legal, finance, general administration, corporate
marketing expenses and charges related to the stock option purchase, all of
which total up to $199.4 million and $76.2 million for the three months ended
April 26, 2009 and April 27, 2008, respectively, that we do not allocate to our
other operating segments as these expenses are not included in the segment
operating performance measures evaluated by our CODM. &#8220;All Other&#8221; also includes
the results of operations of other miscellaneous reporting segments that are
neither individually reportable, nor aggregated with another operating segment.
Revenue in the &#8220;All Other&#8221; category is primarily derived from sales of
components.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our CODM
does not review any information regarding total assets on an operating segment
basis. Operating segments do not record intersegment revenue, and, accordingly,
there is none to be reported.&#160;The accounting policies for segment reporting
are the same as for NVIDIA as a whole.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

by geographic region is allocated to individual countries based on the location
to which the products are initially billed even if our customers&#8217; revenue is
attributable to end customers that are located in a different location. The
following tables summarize information pertaining to our revenue from customers
based on invoicing address in different geographic regions:</font></div>

          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES

          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Unaudited)

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revenue
from significant customers, those representing 10% or more of total revenue
aggregated approximately 22% of our total revenue from two customers&#160;for

revenue from another customer for the three months ended&#160;April 27,
2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Accounts
receivable from significant customers, those representing 10% or more of total
accounts receivable aggregated approximately 27% of our accounts receivable
balance from two customers at April 26, 2009 and approximately 38% of our
accounts receivable balance from three customers at January 25,
2009.</font></div><br><br>

      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;

        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
